intro: Heteropterys coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf sandarac, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rough, leathery leaves that are often covered in a whitish bloom. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. The bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
